nodes.bodyText: Can we actually change this part of the message "Please install the app yourself or request a compatibility update." to "Please install the app manually or request a compatibility update."
What determines if the status-code is an error or if an exception is thrown?
This was from the existing code, it requires access to Response object which is now created on line 82 so we included it into the try-catch block.

Right, but isn't 404 an error status-code? Why does an exception get thrown for a 404 and not for any other error code (like 400, 401, 500, etc).
To clarify my questions:

Will jiraAppService.installMarketplaceServerApp(...) only throw an exception for a 404 or will it also throw an exception for other errors?
Which errors does response.isStatusCodeError() work for if an exception is being thrown for some errors?

From looking at the code the jira service will throw an exception for any response where the response code >= 400 a bad request.  The response.isStatusCodeError isn't needed here since if there is an error an exception will always be thrown.
If that's the case, does that mean that before these changes, this never worked?
It was likely there just in case the library changed.
We should consider wrapping this exception in an Optional and returning it like we do for other errors in this method.

We may want to insert "Error: " in here:

update. " + e.getMessage()

so that it becomes:

update. Error: " + e.getMessage()
